newsitem.title: PERU: Peru's July electrical output up 5.0 pct.
newsitem.headline: Peru's July electrical output up 5.0 pct.

text.p: Peru's electrical power output in July rose 5.0 percent to 1,421 gigawatt hours (GWh), compared with the same month last year, the Energy and Mines Ministry said Wednesday.
Electrical power output in the first seven months of the year was up 2.52 percent to 9,263 GWh, compared with the same period last year, according to a ministry report.
Public service firms produced in July 1,124 GWh while firms generating their own power produced the remaining 297 GWh of the country's total output.
In the first seven months, public service firms produced 7,460 GWh, while firms generating their own power produced the remaining 1,803 GWh.

State-run Electroperu, the largest of Peru's power- generating public service firms, produced 533 GWh in July, down 15.6 percent compared with the same month last year. The state company produced 4,416 GWh in the first seven months, off 15.5 percent.
